text:
This is interesting.. I have a function:
```function A(h, k, Bo)::Float64

	return h * (Bo + k)

end```
When I call it via two another functions:

```println(A(1,1,1))```
it works like it should. But, when I call it via third function like this:

```function dQ(mode, Ha::Float64, Qa::Float64, Hb::Float64, Qb::Float64, p::Parametrirakenne)

	println(A(1,1,1))```
result is "ERROR: LoadError: UndefVarError: A not defined".

What could be wrong?

it works like it should. But, when I call it via third function like this:

function dQ(mode, Ha::Float64, Qa::Float64, Hb::Float64, Qb::Float64, p::Parametrirakenne)

result is "ERROR: LoadError: UndefVarError: A not defined".

What could be wrong?

text: Im assuming the function `dQ` missing an `end` is just a typo?
It should work, provided they're both loaded in the same file.

elements.text: It should work, provided they're both loaded in the same file.

text: They are in same file. But, this code starts to be so repaired, that it seems, that its better to code again with smarter architecture,
